summary: Email chain between FBI, US Attorney's Office, and US Marshals Service discussing Jeffrey Epstein's potential International Megan's Law violations for unreported travel to Austria and Morocco in 2019, and efforts to identify additional victims from the Caribbean region.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of International Megan's Law violation investigation for failing to report travel to Austria and Morocco as a registered sex offender.

persons.name: Senior Inspector
persons.context: Conducted investigation into Epstein's IML violations, provided documentation of unreported travel to Austria and Morocco.

connections.description: Senior Inspector investigated Epstein for International Megan's Law violations regarding unreported travel.

events.title: Epstein signs Virgin Islands sex offender travel form
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed the Virgin Islands sex offender registry Notification of Duty to Report Travel (IML) form.

events.title: Epstein travels to Vienna, Austria
events.description: Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria with three female passengers for coffee, which appears to have been unreported as required by IML.

events.title: Epstein travels to Morocco
events.description: Epstein traveled to Morocco, which appears to have been unreported as required by IML.

events.title: USMS provides IML violation documents
events.description: Senior Inspector from US Marshals Service provided documents regarding Epstein's IML violations to the US Attorney's Office.

events.title: FBI coordination on Epstein investigation
events.description: Email chain discussing Epstein's IML violations and efforts to identify victims from Caribbean region.

keyFacts: Epstein signed Virgin Islands sex offender travel reporting form on March 15, 2019.
Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria on March 22, 2019 with three female passengers without reporting as required by International Megan's Law.
Epstein traveled to Morocco on April 25, 2019 without reporting as required by International Megan's Law.
Law enforcement expressed concern that Epstein's failure to report travel indicated he was a flight risk.
Investigators were seeking to identify additional victims from Caribbean region who may have visited Epstein's St. Thomas compound.
